content: this legal case involves a compensation claim and has reached the court of appeal the court determined that one party should receive 80 of the property and the other party should receive 20 the supreme court ruled that the amount of one spouses share should be determined based on the other spouses share the court dismissed the counterclaim made by the defendant and ordered one party to bear the costs of the appeal proceedings the defendant appealed the court order claiming procedural breaches and errors in the application of the law the court will need to determine the validity of the counterclaim and whether the assets in question overlap with the applicants claim the court found that the defendant could assert a different interest in the property through objection or counterclaim but the counterclaim was dismissed in this case the defendant still has the right to make a claim regarding the property the appeal was unfounded and the court upheld the partial dismissal of the defendants counterclaim the defendant is not entitled to reimbursement of costs for the appeal but the plaintiff may be liable for costs in response to the appeal
